unnormalised: The annual Amarnath Yatra is set to commence on 01/07/2024, with registrations already underway since 15/04/2024. The journey to the holy shrine, located at an altitude of 3,888 meters in the Himalayas, presents considerable logistical challenges.

normalised: Security measures have been significantly enhanced, with over thirty thousand security personnel deployed along the route from Jammu to the base camps at Baltal and Pahalgam. The S-A-S-B has implemented a compulsory registration process and medical certification for all yatris. unnormalised: Special provisions have been made for transportation, including helicopter services from Srinagar to Panjtarni, costing approximately Rs. 3500 per person. The J&K government has also arranged for additional buses and taxis to facilitate travel. Pilgrims are urged to adhere to all safety guidelines and cooperate with the security forces to ensure a smooth and secure pilgrimage.

unnormalised: The Yatra is expected to conclude on 31/08/2024, coinciding with Raksha Bandhan. Devotees are requested to respect the sanctity of the environment and avoid littering along the route.
